intro: Bonellia lippoldii, commonly known as the pink sea anemone, is a marine cnidarian belonging to the family Actiniidae. It is characterized by its soft, fleshy body and long, slender tentacles that are used for capturing prey. The polypoid body is typically pink or reddish in color, and it thrives in shallow coastal waters. Bonellia lippoldii lacks a medusa stage and is primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in marine ecosystems.
